intro: Dendrophthoe trigona, commonly known as the Indian milk bush, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It grows as a shrub, often found in tropical and subtropical regions, and attaches itself to the stems of other plants to obtain nutrients. The plant has small, simple leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Dendrophthoe trigona is noted for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its unique parasitic growth habit.
